articles.author: Soo Kim
articles.title: Thousands of Pets Trapped in Wuhan Lockdown Face Death from Starvation Following Coronavirus Outbreak
articles.description: The capital of Hubei province, where the virus was first discovered, has been on lockdown since January 23.
articles.content:
Thousands of pets in Wuhan are estimated to be trapped inside homes and in danger of dying from starvation in the absence of their owners, who have not been allowed to return to the city following the ongoing coronavirus outbreak, animal advocates claim.
The… [+4907 chars]

articles.author: Jason Murdock
articles.title: Alex Jones Infowars Youtube Videos Uploaded by Proxy Accounts Attracted Hundreds of Thousands of Views, Despite Ban
articles.description: Multiple YouTube accounts distributing content from Infowars were created last October and remained online until today, when "Newsweek" approached Google for comment.
articles.content:
YouTube channels sharing content from Alex Jones and his website Infowars have attracted hundreds of thousands of views, despite the host's ban from the platform.

articles.title: Coronavirus Update: Confirmed Cases Surpass 17,000 As Death Toll Rises
articles.description: There are now 11 cases in the United States, but officials are urging people not to panic because the risk of being exposed is still low.
articles.content:
As researchers try to learn more about the new coronavirus strain, confirmed cases and the death toll continue to rise.

articles.title: China Accuses U.S. of 'Manufacturing and Spreading Panic' With Coronavirus Travel Ban, Evacuations

articles.content:
As cases of a new coronavirus rise in the United States, so has the government's response, prompting condemnation from China for causing panic instead of offering aid.

articles.title: Coronavirus Fears Rise As U.S. Denies Entry to Foreign Nationals Who Have Traveled to China in Last 14 Days

articles.author: Margaret Hamburg, Mark Smolinski
articles.title: The Coronavirus Outbreak Is A Wake-up Call Showing How Unprepared We Are To Deal With Biological Threats
articles.description: A disease in a remote part of the world can be in your backyard tomorrow. But though each outbreak captured the attention of the public and the politicians, as fears subsided, complacency set it.
articles.content:
In 2011, a novel virus,MEV-1, emerged from China and quickly spread throughout the world, killing 2.5 million people in the U.S. and 26 million worldwide.

articles.content:

articles.description: The virus which has spread to over 20 countries has killed over 300 people.
articles.content:
A woman with the mysterious new coronavirus that has killed hundreds of people has given birth to a healthy baby, according to Chinese authorities.
